body.p: To his Excellency Gov Beriah Magoffin Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your petitioner Andrew Ingram would most respectfully state to your Excellency that in the month of August 1860 he was tried for a breach of the peace before Esquire Thomas Spencer in the county of Bath and that he was fined the sum of $30 and committed to the Jail of Bath County for fifteeen days. he thinks the verdict a hard one, that he is a poor man. having a large family dependent upon him for a livelihood -- and he prays your Excellency to remit the aforesaid fine and imprisonment, and he will ever pray &c
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 26th day of October 1860

Bath J P
$30. & 15 days Impt.
breach of the peace
Respd 12 mos
Issd Nov 12. 1860
Andrew Ingram
